channel.title: Server problems (who ever helps me gets admin)
channel.description: [b][/b] Ok i opened up my new server about a 3 days ago and it worked fine until now. i didnt do anything and now no-one cant get on and i cant put it on the server status cuz it says its offline. I tried everything. i re-did the portfowarding. i made a new no-ip. i re-made the "add port" thing in the firewall. is there anything else that might work? :eek:

item.title: Server problems (who ever helps me gets admin)
item.dc:creator: @dx5000078 dx5000078
item.description:
@dx5000078 wrote:

ok now i have a static ip do i w8 24 hours becousei tryed to register server it didnt work[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 22, 2008, 05:52:25 PM[/size][hr] go to teamviewer.com and download that and wehre is says my id put 19832883 and the pass is 6110 make sure its on remote suport it will let u look at my comp and u can try to fix

Read full topic

item.title: Server problems (who ever helps me gets admin)
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

dx5000078:

nope didnt work it in vaild i need the Static DNS 1

Your ISP should’ve provided you with two. But, here’s two [free] public DNS servers, if everything else fails.
205.234.170.215
205.234.170.217

Read full topic

item.title: Server problems (who ever helps me gets admin)
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

[quote=“dx5000078, post:6, topic:221761”]ok seems like u might kno y so go to teamviewer and ill open the router page[br][br][size=1]Posted on: July 22, 2008, 05:12:36 PM[/size][hr][quote author=Hidendra link=topic=291210.msg2347115#msg2347115 date=1216786181]
Are you using DHCP? If you port forwarded then your local IP will automatically change in ~24 hours of the local ip lease, anyway.
If you are using DHCP, use a static local IP.
[/quote] OOOOOO I SEE i did this partialy i tryed to accecpt but i dont kno what to put for the dns[/quote]
DNS: 192.168.1.1 in most cases.

Read full topic

@hidendra wrote:

Are you using DHCP? If you port forwarded then your local IP will automatically change in ~24 hours of the local ip lease, anyway.
If you are using DHCP, use a static local IP.
